author: Marcin Strachu Opałka

text:
I still love this ear-relaxing opening theme to this day, and also this is one of my favorite soundtracks of video game history. When the first time i played this game 12 years ago, I assumed the opening theme's singer was singing in an Old European language (which it's not); that assumption was heavily based on Suikoden III's Medievalic atmosphere & setting.
On the other hand, Just by listening to this masterpiece's makes me feel like being a nomadic person wandering in a Mongolian or even Tibetan grassland.What A Wonderful Imagination.
This OST truly deserved to get Remastered :'(

author: Tony Montana

text: @Goldsac actually, they probably are singing actual words. the only problem is lack of translators who KNOW the language. the group who sang this: Himekami, is a semi-traditional taiko(drum dance) group. they sing in a very, very ancient Japanese language thats become obsolete today. Its very hard to translate, and not many people learn how to, from what I hear. So it might be gibberish, it might be that language. Whos to say?
